job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Easy to obtain training in whatever you want to specialize in.
cons: Everything. Hours. Management. Patient Ratios. Pay.

job_title: RN II in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Love the area the hospital is in, convenient drive located near the 95 and the 215. Hospital has frequent employee engagement events for staff. Diverse working environment. Coffee shop inside the hospital (Day shift perk). New-hire conference with the CEO, CNO, CFO, ACNO after your first month to get NEW employee feedback. 5k referral bonus given if you get a nurse to work for the company for the first time. TV in the large breakroom. Nurses get a shift floating with different departments (RT, Cath Lab, IR) which helps nurses get a better understanding of these departments.
cons: Purposely understaffing to maintain 6-7:1 ratio (SOMETIMES 8:1) in the medical-surgical units despite having pre-COVID staffing numbers, previous ratio was 5:1 pre-Covid. This hospital practices an unhealthy habit of having 1 charge nurse for 4 DIFFERENT MEDICAL-SURGICAL (MS) UNITS this has become "normal" and happens often. They utilize predatory employment contracts to dupe new grad nurses and new to critical care nurses into 2-year obligation contracts with NO SIGN ON BONUS! For a facility that is only 15 years old equipment is often broken such as monitors, mouses, keyboards, WOWs, MRI machine, CT machine. The employee parking lot is horrendous too small for how large the hospital has grown. Nursing management rounds purely to check off that it has been done which can come off insincere, management micro manages the staff. Very big on lunch breaks being taken but not on your state required 15 min breaks that should also be taken. LOTS of RULES AND PROTOCOLS to the point that it's not even to the benefit of the patient but the hospital.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) in Las Vegas, NV
pros: This was my first hospital CNA job, and everyone has been so helpful and amazing to work with.
cons: I am a part-time employee, so I work twice a week. Out of the two days I work per week, I am floated to a different floor at least 50% of the time.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Good work experiences with co-workers on the floor. Nurses usually always can work together. Always going to be some problems.
cons: Upper management has had increasing lack of concern with direct care of nurses on floor. Nurses must wear N95 masks 3 days due to shortage. Well let's just spread the diseases around to everyone no matter what. How ridiculous. Common sense should come into play somewhere and recognize that you are not going to be protected and going to put people at risk here.

job_title: Nursery RN in North Las Vegas, NV

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: WE in our department try to do as little work as possible. We are looking at job security, without having to work for it. I am overpaid for doing nothing.
cons: No one in the administration cares about us not having to work and getting paid for it. We are money collectors. and really don't care if the job ever gets done.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Here at centennial hill hospital the teamwork with staff is outstanding, a nurse is not left behind.  We all get along well, we all respect one another
cons: Nurse patient ratio 1:7, it can difficult  to manage time management when all your pts are demanding and you have discharges and admissions

job_title: Phlebotomist in Las Vegas, NV

cons: The Phlebotomy Department, HR and Administration is Very corrupt..No support whatsoever. They undermine the phlebotomists and completely do care about Us as a whole. A Phlebotomist resently passed because of the stress that she was put under working for this company...
